author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: كْرِ تَشْهَدُ بِنِسْيَانِهَا وَمَحْوِهَا عِنْدَ ظُهُوراتِ آيَاتِكَ وَبُرُوزَاتِ ذِكْرِكَ، فَلَمَّا كانَ الأَمْرُ كَذلِكَ ما يَفْعَلُ هذا الفَقِيرُ وَبِأَيِّ حَبْلٍ يَتَمَسَّكُ هذ
translation: The quintessence of knowledge, O my Lord, proclaimeth its powerlessness to know Thee, and perplexity, in its very soul, confesseth its bewilderment in the face of the revelations of Thy sovereign might, and remembrance, in its inmost spirit, acknowledgeth its forgetfulness and effacement before the manifestations of Thy signs and the evidences of Thy praise. What, then, can this poor creature hope to achieve, and to what cord must this wretched soul cling?
